nodes.bodyText: You don't need to mention String.
You don't need to mention String.
Suggestion: reduce the number of parenthesis like if (decoded != null && !decoded.isBlank()) {
Even if null annotation is not implemented for this  binding, could you please add @Nullable to the decoded parameter.
Please add @Nullable to the decoded parameter.
Please add @Nullable to the decoded parameter.
Looks a little weird...
Ha, this isn't really necessary, just trying to line up the hex output nicely to make it more readable by only printing hex strings of consistent lengths. I can simplify.
Please add addDebugInfo with data parameter of type byte. It will be used at several places.

You can call addDebugInfo(String, byte) and it will happily promote the byte to an int and use this variant. This is already being done in some places and it seems to work fine. I didn't add a byte variant to avoid unnecessary duplication, but I can if you think it's important?
Is it called sometimes with an int or is it always with a byte as parameter ?
You could use your new variable panelTypeNr
Why suppressing this log ?

Because immediately below is an unconditional call to addDebugInfo("Panel type", panelTypeNr, panelTypeStr); and panelTypeStr in that case will be UNKNOWN, so I didn't see the need to log the same message twice.
Ok
Put your name as author of this class.

nodes.bodyText: This should be moved in the next if

Can enroll be anything other than 0x01? Does it send a 0x00 for an unenrollment for example? There's another message inside the conditional, so I kept this one out to always log the value of the enroll parameter.
I don't know if enroll can be other than 1. But it is safer t consider it can be.
Missing else sending ACK.
You're right, I missed the case where subType == 0x0A but enroll != 0x01. I'll add an ack for that case.

I don't know if the result is the same as before.
I hope you have seriously tested this code.
